requirements.question: Is Defense AI / National Security Technology Transformation accessible to new entrants or structurally locked by incumbents/regulation?
validation_data: Startup funding in Defense AI / National Security Technology sectors (2024-2026) from Crunchbase/PitchBook
New establishment formation rate in NAICS 928110, 92 (Census Business Dynamics)
Regulatory permitting/licensing timeline for new entrants in this sector
HHI (market concentration) for key sub-sectors
requirements.threshold_validate: 3+ startups funded >$10M in 24mo AND establishment formation rate positive AND HHI < 2500
requirements.threshold_falsify: 0-1 startups funded AND establishment formation declining AND HHI > 5000
requirements.score_impact_if_validated: TN-008 models: MO += 1-2, avg O rises by ~5-8 points
requirements.score_impact_if_falsified: TN-008 TNS ES -= 1.0, models confirmed FORTIFIED/LOCKED

requirements.question: Is Wholesale Trade Transformation genuinely open for new entrants, or are O-scores inflated by heuristic scoring?
validation_data: Venture funding and startup activity in Wholesale Trade (2024-2026)
Incumbent digital adoption rate in this sector
Customer switching costs and contract lock-in data
Technology pilot programs and deployment timelines
requirements.threshold_validate: Active startup ecosystem AND low switching costs AND technology adoption accelerating
requirements.threshold_falsify: No funded startups AND high incumbent adoption AND long contract cycles (3+ years)
requirements.score_impact_if_validated: TN-007 TNS ES += 0.5-1.0, narrative may upgrade to MAJOR
requirements.score_impact_if_falsified: TN-007 models: MO -= 1-2, some may drop to CONTESTED

requirements.question: Why does 'full_service_replacement' architecture score O=69.1 in Wholesale Trade Transformation but only O=40.5 in Management of Companies and Enterprises Transformation? What market structure variable explains the 29-point gap?
validation_data: Market concentration (HHI) comparison: Wholesale Trade vs Management of Companies and Enterprises
Incumbent technology adoption rates in both sectors
Regulatory barriers comparison between sectors
Customer procurement patterns (RFP vs self-serve) in both sectors
Successful full_service_replacement startups in Management of Companies and Enterprises (existence proof)
requirements.threshold_validate: Structural differences confirmed (HHI gap > 1000 or regulatory barrier identified) → gap is real, scores are correct
requirements.threshold_falsify: No structural difference found → scoring heuristic is creating artificial gap, worst-sector MO should increase
requirements.score_impact_if_validated: Worst-sector scores confirmed accurate. Best-sector pattern does not transfer.

requirements.question: Why does 'rollup_consolidation' architecture score O=78.0 in Micro-Firm AI Economy (Emerging Category) Transformation but only O=58.0 in Retail Trade Transformation? What market structure variable explains the 20-point gap?
validation_data: Market concentration (HHI) comparison: Micro-Firm AI Economy (Emerging Category) vs Retail Trade
Incumbent technology adoption rates in both sectors
Regulatory barriers comparison between sectors
Customer procurement patterns (RFP vs self-serve) in both sectors
Successful rollup_consolidation startups in Retail Trade (existence proof)
requirements.threshold_validate: Structural differences confirmed (HHI gap > 1000 or regulatory barrier identified) → gap is real, scores are correct
requirements.threshold_falsify: No structural difference found → scoring heuristic is creating artificial gap, worst-sector MO should increase
requirements.score_impact_if_validated: Worst-sector scores confirmed accurate. Best-sector pattern does not transfer.

requirements.question: 16 models have T >> O (transformation certain but market closed). Top gaps: Retail Media Network Platform (+49), Defense AI/ML Intelligence Fusion Platform (+40), Defense Logistics Optimizer (+40), Intelligent Commercial Earth Observation Analytics Platform (+37), Critical Minerals Exploration & Resource Estimation Platform (+36). Should these be decomposed into accessible sub-layers?
validation_data: Value chain analysis of top-gap models: which layers are accessible?
Successful startup examples in adjacent/sub-layer markets
Incumbent vulnerability analysis (debt, tech debt, succession)
requirements.threshold_validate: 2+ models can be decomposed into layers with O > 55
requirements.threshold_falsify: All layers are equally fortified → these are genuinely locked markets
requirements.score_impact_if_validated: Parent models get decomposed; sub-models created with independent CLA scores
requirements.score_impact_if_falsified: Models confirmed as observation-only (high T, low O = watch but don't enter)

requirements.question: 1 models have O >> T (market open but transformation uncertain). Top gaps: Open-Source Education Assessment Platform (-32). What external evidence would validate these transformations?
validation_data: Technology readiness evidence for transformation thesis
Market adoption data (pilot programs, early customers)
Competitive landscape: are startups actually entering?
requirements.threshold_validate: Technology proven in production AND 3+ startups funded → T-score should rise
requirements.threshold_falsify: Technology still experimental AND no startup activity → O-score may be inflated
requirements.score_impact_if_validated: Models T-score components (SN, FA) increase by 1-2 points
requirements.score_impact_if_falsified: Models flagged as 'premature opportunity' — O maintained but confidence lowered

requirements.question: Force F4_capital has 283 models with 11.0% fund-returner rate (vs 7.1% baseline). Is VCR scoring biased toward F4_capital's typical market structures, or does this force genuinely produce better investments?
validation_data: Actual VC funding data for F4_capital-driven startups (2024-2026)
Exit multiples for F4_capital-focused companies vs overall market
VCR scoring formula: check if F4_capital market structures are penalized/rewarded by architecture defaults
requirements.threshold_validate: Real-world VC data confirms enriched pattern → VCR scoring is accurate
requirements.threshold_falsify: Real-world data contradicts → VCR heuristic has F4_capital-specific bias, recalibrate
requirements.score_impact_if_falsified: Recalibrate VCR heuristic for F4_capital market structures (±1-2 on CAP/VEL)

requirements.question: Force F2_demographics has 344 models but only 4.4% fund-returner rate (vs 7.1% baseline). Are F2_demographics-driven models systematically underscored on VCR, or is investability genuinely lower?
validation_data: Actual VC funding data for F2_demographics-driven startups (2024-2026)
Exit multiples for F2_demographics-focused companies vs overall market
VCR scoring formula: check if F2_demographics market structures are penalized/rewarded by architecture defaults
requirements.threshold_validate: Real-world VC data confirms suppressed pattern → VCR scoring is accurate
requirements.threshold_falsify: Real-world data contradicts → VCR heuristic has F2_demographics-specific bias, recalibrate
requirements.score_impact_if_falsified: Recalibrate VCR heuristic for F2_demographics market structures (±1-2 on CAP/VEL)

requirements.question: In Defense AI / National Security Technology Transformation, what_needed models avg T=69.7 vs what_works T=67.0. Is infrastructure genuinely more structurally necessary, or are SN/FA scores inherited from parent sector?
validation_data: Check SN/FA scoring derivation for what_needed models in TN-008
Compare sector-level SN with model-level SN (inheritance test)
Infrastructure deployment timelines vs business model timelines
requirements.threshold_validate: Infrastructure SN/FA scores based on independent evidence → paradox is real structural finding
requirements.threshold_falsify: SN/FA inherited from parent sector → scoring artifact, adjust what_needed SN downward
requirements.score_impact_if_validated: No change — infrastructure genuinely scores higher on structural necessity

requirements.question: TNS and model O-scores are disconnected (r≈0). Should narrative strength predict market openness at all?
validation_data: Review TNS formula: does Evidence Strength (ES) incorporate O-score information?
Check if narrative-level market accessibility signals should feed into TNS
Compare narrative collisions to O-score patterns
requirements.threshold_validate: TNS and O intentionally measure different things → disconnection is by design
requirements.threshold_falsify: Narratives should predict openness → add O-score signal to TNS ES component
requirements.score_impact_if_validated: No change — independence is a feature
requirements.score_impact_if_falsified: TNS ES formula updated to incorporate avg model O-score quality signal
